p: Low-grade fever (usually lower than 38°) and fatigue may precede the cutaneous exanthema (rash) in about 65%–70% of cases. The fever usually persists for 1–4 days to a maximum of 7 days.[ 57 59] Arthralgia accounts for the third most frequently occurring manifestation (seen in 65% of cases). About 20%–45% of patients present with periarticular edema, especially of small joints (hands and feet, and less frequently knees and wrists) in association with Arthralgia, which may last for a week up to a month.[ 57]
